sen.j: 宝亀3年（772年）に赦免されて従五位下藤原朝臣に戻されて官界に復帰した。
sen.e: After he was pardoned and released in 772, with the support of Fujiwara no Ason, Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade), he returned to the government.

sen.j: なお、『尊卑分脈』において、刷雄の兄弟とされている藤原薩雄は、刷雄と同一人物とする説がある。
sen.e: There is a view, in "Sonpi Bunmyaku" (a Japanese genealogical text), that FUJIWARA no Yoshio (薩雄) who is said to be a brother of Yoshio (刷雄), are in fact the same person.

sen.j: 薗田香融は『続日本紀』にある天平宝字2年の無位から従五位下とする記述は当時の遣唐留学生の叙位としては異例なだけではなく、当時健在であった4人の兄の位階の昇進の例（いずれも正六位上から従五位下に昇進している）を越してしまう事を指摘してこの記事には誤りが含まれているとしている。
sen.e: Koyu SONODA claims that "Shoku Nihongi" (Chronicles of Japan II) has false information for the following reasons : In the year 758, it would have been extremely unusual, that FUJIWARA no Yoshio as an overseas student in Kentoshi-shi would receive Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) from No Rank; This means that he was in the same rank as his four older brothers, who were still alive and well at this point, who were promoted one rank from Shorokuinojo (Senior Sixth Rank, Upper Grade) to Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Koyu SONODA claims that "Shoku Nihongi" (Chronicles of Japan II) has false information for the following reason: In the year 758, it would have been extremely unusual for FUJIWARA no Yoshio as an exchange student Kentoshi to be promoted to Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) from no rank, for this would mean that he was promoted ahead of his four older brothers (The older brothers were promoted one rank from Shorokuinojo [Senior Sixth Rank, Upper Grade] to Jugoinoge).
sen.cmt: 文章の意味がかわっていたので変訳。『続日本紀』によるとよしおは兄より上に昇進したことになる。ほんやくしゃは、兄と同じ階級に昇進したと訳しています。あと英語に訳すとき当時健在という表現はあまりしないので、省きました。
sen.e: Koyu SONODA claims that "Shoku Nihongi" (Chronicles of Japan II) has false information for the following reason: In the year 758, it would have been extremely unusual for FUJIWARA no Yoshio as an exchange student Kentoshi to be promoted to Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) from no rank, for this would mean that he was promoted ahead of his four older brothers (The older brothers were promoted one rank from Shorokuinojo [Senior Sixth Rank, Upper Grade] to Jugoinoge).

sen.j: よって、『続日本紀』翌年天平宝字3年6月庚戊に正六位上から従五位下に叙された薩雄を刷雄と同一人物とする説を述べている。
sen.e: For that reason, he has a view that the Yoshio (薩雄) who, according to "Shoku Nihongi" (Chronicles of Japan II), was honored in July 759 with Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) and promoted from Shorokuinojo (Senior Sixth Rank, Upper Grade), was in fact Yoshio(刷雄).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処 また、同音異名の人物に関する記述につき、漢字名を織り込んでいます。
sen.e: For that reason, there is a theory that Yoshio(薩雄), who, according to "Shoku Nihongi" (Chronicles of Japan II), was honored in July 759 with Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade), and promoted from Shorokuinojo (Senior Sixth Rank, Upper Grade), is the one and the same person as Yoshio(刷雄).
sen.cmt: この方が文章がまとまります。
sen.e: For that reason, there is a theory that Yoshio(薩雄), who, according to "Shoku Nihongi" (Chronicles of Japan II), was honored in July 759 with Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade), and promoted from Shorokuinojo (Senior Sixth Rank, Upper Grade), is the one and the same person as Yoshio(刷雄).

sen.j: 天平宝字2年の父・仲麻呂は「恵美押勝」に改名している。
sen.e: Yoshio's father, Nakamaro, changed his name to 'EMI no Oshikasu' in 758.

sen.j: 吉川敏子は、前後して若い頃に仏道修行をしていた刷雄に「菩薩」に通じる"薩"の字が与えらた。
sen.e: According to Toshiko YOSHIKAWA, at the same time, it is likely that Yoshio was given the Chinese character 薩 for his name, which relates to 菩薩 (Bodhisattva), as he had Buddhist trainings when he was young and that during the EMI no Oshikatsu's War, he was deprived of his new name and made to use his former name. This would suppose that the two Yoshios mentioned are in fact the same person.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処 また、漢字名の解説文が含まれるため、漢字を文中に織り込んでいます。
sen.e: According to Toshiko YOSHIKAWA, it was likely that during his early Buddhist training, Yoshio was given the Chinese character 薩 for his name, which relates to 菩薩 (Bodhisattva).
sen.cmt: わかりやすく変訳しました。一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: According to Toshiko YOSHIKAWA, it was likely that during his early Buddhist training, Yoshio was given the Chinese character 薩 for his name, which relates to 菩薩 (Bodhisattva).

sen.j: しかし、恵美押勝の乱の際に剥奪されて旧名の刷雄に戻されたとすれば、両者が同一人物としての説明が可能であると唱えている。
sen.e: However, if it was true that he was deprived of his new name during the Rebellion of Emi no Oshikatsu and forced to use his former name, the theory that the two are the same person would be possible.
